Room.Name: The Great Hall of Dargaard
Room.Description: In this, the Great Hall, you feel nothing but absolute terror and hate literally flowing from the walls in the form of the white fog that is so thick and cold on the ground that there is a real danger of your feet and legs going numb and you will be left to crawl away from the Keep, to be at the mercy of the undead minions that dwell here. Great tapestries line the walls, enormous paintings are mixed with them. You are not wanted here, you are not needed here, and whatever the driving force behind the thick fog it will do its best to drag you down into it and leave you there to die and then undie, to become just another horrible creature of the night and to terrify children in their sleep at the mere thought of you. South and east, doors bar the way into other rooms where something dwells that does not want you to disturb it, lest it be forced to abandon all thought of the little life that it still clings to and to devour you into the stony silence of Dargaard Keep.

Room.Name: A private counsel room
Room.Description: The room is small enough for only two people at one time, but that puts no limit on the number of malevolent spirits that can inhabit the space. The same fog rolls all around this room, up to waist level on a human, nearly up to a dwarf's or a kender's neck. It has no inhibitions as it did, because it knows somehow that you cannot escape it now and there is no possible way that you can run to get away from it. The deaths plotted in this room, all the negative energies and thought engineered over the years have sat and fermented here, building up over time and culminating in an evil so powerful that it alone can give power to Lord Soth for centuries to come.

Room.Name: A private counsel room
Room.Description: The room is small enough for only two people at one time, but that puts no limit on the number of malevolent spirits that can inhabit the space. The same fog rolls all around this room, up to waist level on a human, nearly up to a dwarf's or a kender's neck. It has no inhibitions as it did, because it knows somehow that you cannot escape it now and there is no possible way that you can run to get away from it. The deaths plotted in this room, all the negative energies and thought engineered over the years have sat and fermented here, building up over time and culminating in an evil so powerful that it alone can give power to Lord Soth for centuries to come.

Room.Name: A pious altar
Room.Description: This holy place still retains its holy feel; no fog lies here, forcing no feel of hate, but it is replaced by the ethereal mist that drifts through the walls and air. Two torches light the room with a blue glow, and a feel of something sad is here, the sounds of a forsaken being fill the room with utter despair and a wondering of why. The door to the hall is in the west wall, but whatever is sad here wants you to feel its pain and to do something for it before you leave ...

Room.Name: A quiet shrine
Room.Description: This room is quiet except for what seems like the sounds of something quietly weeping in an indeterminable place. It comes from all around and yet nowhere at once. The sound of it is maddeningly unreal, it should not exist at this place in time, not at a holy place like this. A shrine is in the room, a quiet place of prayer and peace. The fog is gone from this room, but the wisps of mist and ether drift through here. The door to the rest of the Great Hall is to the west, but something here wants your attention before you do anything else ...

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall curves to the south, where the entrance to the dining hall is, or east, around the dining hall.

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall stretches east and west.

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall curves to the south, where the rear entrance to the dining hall is, or west, around the dining hall.

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall curves to the north, where the entrance to the dining hall is, or west, around the dining hall.

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall stretches to the east and west for a short distance.

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall curves to the north, where the rear entrance to the dining hall is, or west, around the dining hall.

Room.Name: A hallway of Dargaard
Room.Description: You are walking in a small hallway that has a few old tapestries. Torches burn mysteriously, lighting the hall with blue-white flame. A strange mist hangs low to the floor, chilling your legs as you walk through it. It seems to exist on its own volition. A coldness fills the air, an unnatural coldness; it is like the coldness of death. Cries echo through the ruins of the stone keep. They sound sad and mournful, singing a terrifyingly beautiful song in an elven voice. The hall extends north and south. To the west is a oak door that leads to the dining hall, and an iron gate is set in the eastern wall.

Room.Name: Entrance to the courtyard
Room.Description: You are just to the east of the iron gate that kept you from the courtyard. Now that you are in the courtyard, you can see the mist is much thicker here. Dead grey trees rise up out of the fog, dead flowers and herbs lie black in it. Below your feet is a stone pathway that leads east into the courtyard. You hear water gurgling somewhere from within. The chill outdoors is more natural, since you are very high up in the Dargaard mountains, but it is still teeming with the feel of death and something else that you can't define. But still, something is warm here. There are black scorches on the stone and some of the trees around here.

Room.Name: In the courtyard
Room.Description: In the cold, dead courtyard that must have once been a beautiful, green garden, not a sound is to be heard save your own. The song echoes more faintly here, the footsteps and cries from the ruins are not as evident. Pain and fear hang heavy in the frigid air, like the translucent white fog that gives you chills and makes your legs feel heavier than they are. Great trees rise up, ones that must have been wonderful shade trees in their time. Now they are leafless and twisted, warped from the undead presence that pervades every mote of Dargaard Keep.

Room.Name: In the courtyard
Room.Description: In the cold, dead courtyard that must have once been a beautiful, green garden, not a sound is to be heard save your own. The song echoes more faintly here, the footsteps and cries from the ruins are not as evident. Pain and fear hang heavy in the frigid air, like the translucent white fog that gives you chills and makes your legs feel heavier than they are. Great trees rise up, ones that must have been wonderful shade trees in their time. Now they are leafless and twisted, warped from the undead presence that pervades every mote of Dargaard Keep.

Room.Name: Before a fountain in the courtyard
Room.Description: You stand in a clearing ringed by dead trees, their trunks warped and mutated by the undeath here. The strange white fog is especially thick here. And in the darkness that exists even during the day, it glows with an otherworldly aura. You can make out a marble fountain in the center of the clearing, covered with black moss. The liquid looks dark, but then again, it is dark outside all of the time. The fountain continues to gurgle, and on the air you can detect a faint odor of iron. To the south, the rest of the courtyard exists, and a tall stone wall blocks passage east.

Room.Name: In the courtyard
Room.Description: In the cold, dead courtyard that must have once been a beautiful, green garden, not a sound is to be heard save your own. The song echoes more faintly here, the footsteps and cries from the ruins are not as evident. Pain and fear hang heavy in the frigid air, like the translucent white fog that gives you chills and makes your legs feel heavier than they are. Great trees rise up, ones that must have been wonderful shade trees in their time. Now they are leafless and twisted, warped from the undead presence that pervades every mote of Dargaard Keep.

Room.Name: A small orchard
Room.Description: At the southern end of the garden lies this small orchard, with some tall fruit trees planted amongst what used to be flowers and shrubbery. Now everything is dead and grey and cold. The translucent mist laps at your feet, like some sort of living entity that feeds on your lifeforce. It is thick here. The fruit trees are now twisted and grey, like all the other trees that are in this courtyard. Their bark doesn't look real, as if it were an outer casing made by the evil that flows through Dargaard Keep. The orchard appears to continue on to the east, and the rest of the courtyard is north.

Room.Name: In the courtyard
Room.Description: In the cold, dead courtyard that must have once been a beautiful, green garden, not a sound is to be heard save your own. The song echoes more faintly here, the footsteps and cries from the ruins are not as evident. Pain and fear hang heavy in the frigid air, like the translucent white fog that gives you chills and makes your legs feel heavier than they are. Great trees rise up, ones that must have been wonderful shade trees in their time. Now they are leafless and twisted, warped from the undead presence that pervades every mote of Dargaard Keep. To the east, a great wall rises up out of the fog, and from behind that wall emanates an evil power greater than any that you may have met.

Room.Name: In the courtyard
Room.Description: In the cold, dead courtyard that must have once been a beautiful, green garden, not a sound is to be heard save your own. The song echoes more faintly here, the footsteps and cries from the ruins are not as evident. Pain and fear hang heavy in the frigid air, like the translucent white fog that gives you chills and makes your legs feel heavier than they are. Great trees rise up, ones that must have been wonderful shade trees in their time. Now they are leafless and twisted, warped from the undead presence that pervades every mote of Dargaard Keep.

Room.Name: Before a pool of blood
Room.Description: At this alcove of the gardens, which at one time must have been quite cosy, a high wall stands to the west. And from underneath it, a pool of blood is trickling. The trees here seem to feed off the foul liquid, absorbing its energies like they once used to absorb water through their roots. Perhaps it is through this nourishment that the plants are now twisted and corrupt. All around, strange sounds echo. To the west, you hear the sounds of liquid splashing. South, the rest of the courtyard drones on.

Room.Name: In the courtyard
Room.Description: In the cold, dead courtyard that must have once been a beautiful, green garden, not a sound is to be heard save your own. The song echoes more faintly here, the footsteps and cries from the ruins are not as evident. Pain and fear hang heavy in the frigid air, like the translucent white fog that gives you chills and makes your legs feel heavier than they are. Great trees rise up, ones that must have been wonderful shade trees in their time. Now they are leafless and twisted, warped from the undead presence that pervades every mote of Dargaard Keep.

Room.Name: A small orchard
Room.Description: At the southern end of the garden lies this small orchard, with some tall fruit trees planted amongst what used to be flowers and shrubbery. Now everything is dead and grey and cold. The translucent mist laps at your feet, like some sort of living entity that feeds on your lifeforce. It is thick here. The fruit trees are now twisted and grey, like all the other trees that are in this courtyard. Their bark doesn't look real, as if it were an outer casing made by the evil that flows through Dargaard Keep. The orchard appears to continue on to the west, and the rest of the courtyard is north.

Room.Name: Before Lord Soth's Black Throne
Room.Description: Raised up on a platform is a black throne that seems to be the focal point of the room, the focal point for all the undead legions controlled by the fallen knight that could not overcome his base selfishness in Krynn's hour of need. The fog is too thick to breathe, too thick to even think. Some sort of base survival instinct is in the very air, controlling what you think and feel at this moment in time. Nothing here can change the feeling in the Keep, nothing here can match the sheer terror and evil that radiates from the black throne of Lord Soth.

Room.Name: In a short, dark hall
Room.Description: Inside this dark passageway, the chill becomes a hundredfold more pronounced and vicious. Evil intent radiates from the east, and fog lies thick on the ground like the smoke from burning green wood. It creeps up your legs and seems to want to pull you down into it, so it can devour you in its life-sapping essence. There is no light here, all is dark. It is not just because you are inside; it is because something is absorbing the light. Something sinister and evil is close, so close you can feel it, and it knows that you are coming.

Room.Name: Lord Soth's Private Chamber
Room.Description: Here, at the eastern end of the courtyard behind Dargaard Keep, is Lord Soth's private chamber. Here he broods during the day, and at night, he listens to the never-ending song of the undead elven maidens that were cursed to spent forever with him. His seat is here and his arctic presence is here, chilling you deep down to the core of your soul, glaring into your mind with blazing orange eyes, ones that could appear any moment in front of you, appear with a look and a word of death for you, and with that single word of power keep you here with him until Krynn is utterly destroyed, keep you here body and soul.

Room.Name: The fourth floor of the Keep
Room.Description: The mist is gone from this floor of the Keep. The halls echo strange screams in the night and the day. It is a dream that never ends, a dream that you can't wake up from. The undead citizens of this fortress all roam about in the same manner, all convinced that they are merely dreaming and that you are but a figure in the dream, perhaps sharing the same dream. This cruel trick of the mind does much to comfort the souls that are still trapped in the decaying bodies and rotting corpses. To the east, the now-familiar blue-white glow of the cold torches lights the halls and shadows things in a way that doesn't seem quite right. And all about, the same elven song travels lightly on the dark air. West is a door that is not very special-looking, but a cold draft comes from under it.

Room.Name: On a high balcony overlooking the mountains
Room.Description: On this stone balcony, with the cold air all around you and the sky growing dark with night, you feel somehow at peace. A haunting song echoes in the distance somewhere, a song sung by elven voices to Lord Soth. You can see most of the Vingaard mountains from here, and looking straight down, you can see the main gate of the keep. It is a long fall, one that would be fatal to you. Back east, the keep reaches on, cold and dark. And somewhere, the undead elven maidens sing to Lord Soth all night long.

NPC.name: lord soth
NPC.description: Lord Soth ... The fabled Knight of Solamnia who had the power to stop the Cataclysm but failed because of the elves. He is immense, clad in the blackened plate mail of a Solamnic Knight, decorated with a black rose. His deep orange eyes flicker out of what used to be eyesockets, and all around him is an undead chill that makes you afraid ... As well you should be, for this knight has the power to kill with a word.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) The mighty ruler of Dargaard Keep towers above you.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AreaAttack
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Sneak Flying DetectIllusion

NPC.name: elven maiden undead
NPC.description: As she had a part in the downfall of Lord Soth and helped to cause the Cataclysm, this once-beautiful elven maiden is now damned to wander the halls of Dargaard Keep forever. Her spectral form has warped her elven sense of good, and she is now as evil as any.
NPC.longDescription: The spectre of an elven maiden stares at you with eyes of mourning.
NPC.flags: NPC StayArea Wimpy Undead Warrior AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Flying DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: wraith spirit ethereal
NPC.description: The wraith is absolutely hate-filled, composed of nothing but black energies of an eternally damned soul, eternally damned to undeath and corruption. The red eyes burn with outrage at your appearance, resolved on dragging you to the same undying torture that it must suffer until Krynn is sundered and torn.
NPC.longDescription: The menacing form of a wraith materializes before your eyes.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Fade
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sneak Flying PassDoor DetectIllusion DarkVision

NPC.name: skeleton undead knight
NPC.description: As the skeleton turns to look at you, a feeling of impending doom fills you as you realize that even the Solamnic Knights are not safe from Soth's and Takhisis' evil intentions. The skeleton is black as night, and the sword it clutches is rusted and jagged. An undead, unholy red glow fills the skull's eyesockets as it realizes that you can be corrupted just as it was. The chill surrounding it is as tangible as moonlight but still it exudes and fills you with fear.
NPC.longDescription: A black skeleton clad in the antique armor of a knight turns its head at you.
NPC.shortDescription: the black skeleton of a knight
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectIllusion DetectInvis DarkVision

NPC.name: deathknight black dark malaclypse
NPC.description: This long-dead man is huge, is a deathknight. An outcast corrupted long ago by the black magics, corrupted by the urge for power and complete control of the world at large. Malaclypse was his name then and it remains his name still now. He is huge, carrying an pitch-black shortsword and a shield emblazoned with a dying phoenix. His searingly red eyes pierce into you, hungry to devour your soul as well.
NPC.longDescription: A long-dead man arrayed in the armor of a black knight stands motionless.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Undead Warrior AreaAttack
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Haste DetectIllusion

NPC.name: mummy staggering decaying
NPC.description: The mummy is covered in rotting burial bandages and filth. Maggots crawl around under them, eating the rotten flesh and thriving on the undead energies of the creature. The mummy's head wrapping is coming undone, and its flesh is black and putrid. As with all undead, the evil red fire of reanimation and necromancy smolders in its eyes. A low moan escapes the mummy's throat as it sees you, but the creature makes no attempt to attack.
NPC.longDescription: A decaying mummy is staggering about aimlessly.
NPC.flags: NPC StayArea Undead AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectIllusion

NPC.name: burning spectre demon
NPC.description: This malevolent demon is one of many summoned and controlled by Lord Soth, called up from the burning fire pits of Sargonnas to serve as a guardian of his courtyard. The undead spectre itself is a product of shadows, hatred and fire, and it burns with a physical, emotional and spiritual rage against you.
NPC.longDescription: A demon floats menacingly in the room.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Fade
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Flying PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: elven wife spirit ethereal
NPC.description: The elven form, the blood running down her face and body, the crushed arms ... This must be Lord Soth's wife, trapped here by the evil that she called down upon her husband with her dying breath. She looks sad, like she wishes that she never had condemned her husband to his eternal unlife, and prays each day that she will be taken from this, her eternal prison.
NPC.longDescription: (Black aura) A shadowy spirit of elven looks gazes at you sadly.
NPC.shortDescription: the ethereal spirit of Soth's wife
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Undead
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Flying DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: skeleton undead red burning
NPC.description: The skeleton seems to be still "alive" even though it is on fire as you look at it. Even its bones are deep red for some reason. The skeletal hands each clutch onto something that isn't really there ... Or is it? You notice that one of its hands is always frozen into a knife of sorts. Deep down in the skeleton's ribcage, there is what seems to be a black heart, beating against all possiblity.
NPC.longDescription: A burning red skeleton is consumed by a raging inferno.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared DetectIllusion DarkVision

NPC.name: lurching zombie damned corpse
NPC.description: The corpse is a warrior that once challenged Lord Soth ... The corpse was a lot like Lord Soth, too. Proud, courageous, a bit vain. The warrior was determined to defeat the undead man before he could claim any more lives to undeath ... But he failed. Now he is what he hated, a monster, victim of a curse strong enough to last until the High God comes to either prevent the destruction of Krynn ... Or to do it himself.
NPC.longDescription: A living corpse lurches at you from the shadows.
NPC.shortDescription: the zombie of an eternally damned warrior
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectHidden Infrared Plague DetectIllusion DetectInvis PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: minotaur undead zombie reanimated enormous
NPC.description: The minotaur is rotting and decaying, hunks of raw flesh gone from bulging arms and legs, fur stripped away to reveal maggots devouring the rotting flesh, an odor so rank you can barely stand it. The minotaur towers above you, nine feet tall, brandishing a club as thick as one of its arms. In its eyes burns undead evil, a red fire welling up deep inside it. As it shifts its arms to raise its club, part of its tunic falls away, and you see maggots writhing inside, falling onto the floor along with rotten black gore, spattering onto you, releasing an odor so foul you want to vomit.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) An enormous minotaur rises to its feet as it sees you.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior
NPC.affectedBy: DetectIllusion

NPC.name: lich black rotting decaying clerical
NPC.description: The lich is decaying, the lich is rotten ... The lich came here to fight Lord Soth. The fate that has befallen the man that once was is more horrible to him than anything he ever could have thought would happen to him. On his black and rotten left arm is the bearing of the Platinum Dragon Claw, now corroded and twisted. If this can happen to a cleric of Paladine, imagine ... What could Lord Soth do to you?
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) A rotting, decaying lich dressed in clerical robes materializes.
NPC.shortDescription: the lich that was a cleric of Paladine
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Cleric
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Flying DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: lich priestess female
NPC.description: This lich priestess ... Bears the Healing Hand on her arm. And if this was once a cleric of Mishakal, come to turn the undead of Dargaard ... Why was she defeated in such a horrific way? Her healing spells are now useless, now a sick weapon against the undead that she is a part of. Perhaps that is why she was here in the first place: to sear and burn the undead with healing and peace. But now, she is damned like all of Lord Soth's minions.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) A lich with the bearing of the Healing Hand glares at you from the dark.
NPC.shortDescription: the lich priestess who once followed Mishakal
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Cleric
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Flying DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: armor suit knight dark
NPC.description: The armor is fairly normal, if not antique iron armor. It is holding a sword before it, with its point down, like many suits of armor are positioned that are from the time period. Nothing special to it.
NPC.longDescription: A suit of armor is against the wall.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Warrior AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: ProtectGood Flying PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: guardian undead spectral
NPC.description: The guardian is truly spectral. It has no real shape, no real definition to it. It has a black glow about it, it is flying, and you can see mostly through it. That's all you can definitely tell about it. There is one other thing ... It is angered that you have dared to come and disturb Dargaard Keep.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) The spectral guardian of Dargaard Keep stands watch.
NPC.shortDescription: the spectral guardian of Dargaard Keep
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior
NPC.affectedBy: Invisible DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Flying PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: zombie servant
NPC.description: The servant was never educated in life, and it remainst that way in unlife. The zombie stands mute and dumb, unwilling to leave the room until given an order or a reason to do so. Still dressed in servant's clothes which are now torn and bloody, serving Lord Soth is still the first priority here.
NPC.longDescription: The zombie of a servant of the Keep stands here dumbly.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Undead AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectIllusion DetectInvis PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: dog hellhound hound infernal hunting
NPC.description: This dog is also a product of the undead power that soaks Dargaard Keep. Wandering about, searching, hunting still for meat and a kill, hunting like it used to, driven by basic instincts and the undead bloodlust. It will eat anything it can, devouring corpses with relish and feasting on the flesh that it finds. Hellfire rages in the eyes, fur is stripped, revealing raw undead muscle, gaping, pus-filled wounds, and bare patches of ribs.
NPC.longDescription: A hunting dog wanders about with an infernal look in its eyes.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Sneak DetectIllusion

NPC.name: tree corrupted treant grey twisted
NPC.description: The tree might still be alive, but there are no leaves to it, no sign of life at all. The thick trunk is horribly twisted and scarred, probably from all the undead beings roaming the grounds here.
NPC.longDescription: A twisted grey tree rises up ominously in the still of the courtyard.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea
NPC.affectedBy: DetectIllusion

NPC.name: servant skeleton undead grey warrior
NPC.description: The skeleton has been summoned by Lord Soth to finish the job that he could not . . . Which is to kill you. Sword in hand, pointed at your throat, it looks to have been specially prepared for this task.
NPC.longDescription: A grey skeletal warrior stands before you, sword pointed at your throat.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared DetectIllusion DarkVision

NPC.name: treant apple tree grey twisted
NPC.description: Under the same influence as the rest of the garden, the tree is now gnarled, grey, and corrupted. It still produces apples, but they are rotten and don't look too appetizing. It is completely devoid of leaves, and its branches wave in the wind ... Except there is no wind, just the cold fog that covers the ground.
NPC.longDescription: A twisted grey apple tree produces rotten fruit.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea
NPC.affectedBy: DetectIllusion

NPC.name: undead mage abyss
NPC.description: The mage floats though he has legs to stand on. His skin is black and stretched over his skeletal frame. Pure magic courses through what used to be veins, pure evil burns red in his eyesockets now. Dressed in solid black robes, he exudes evil magic in every form imaginable. Now he lives in Dargaard Keep in order to protect it with his Abyss-borne powers from intruders like you.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) A black-robed mage floats eerily before you.
NPC.shortDescription: the undead mage of the Abyss
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Mage
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared ProtectGood Flying PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: evil force cloud
NPC.description: This force of evil is so great and powerful that it alone could give energy and driving force to all the undead forces of Krynn for uncountable aeons. It terrifies, it shocks, and it is possessed with only one thought: to kill off all life and goodness and replace it with darkness and death.
NPC.longDescription: A shimmering black mass of evil power fills the room.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead AreaAttack
NPC.affectedBy: Invisible DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared ProtectEvil PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: shadow lich
NPC.description: The lich is just a shadow, something constructed of pure hate and a desire to purge the realms of life, love, and light.
NPC.longDescription: A shadow of a lich comes out of the cloud of evil.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared PassDoor DetectIllusion Flying DarkVision

NPC.name: dracolich huge mount red
NPC.description: The dracolich is surrounded by a perpetual black aura of hatred and evil. It is outfitted in black battle armor, the kind that dragonriders use for their mounts. On the breast of the armor is the signet of Dargaard Keep, and that can only mean that this enormous red beast is Lord Soth's personal mount, to ride into battle and to bring about more death, more loss of life. As it sees you, the dragon opens wide its mouth and hisses, blasting the room with hot, putrid breath. This contrasts sharply with the horrid chill that radiates from its body.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) A hulking lich-dragon towers above you, wings beating slowly.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared ProtectGood Flying DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: necromancer experienced
NPC.description: The drow looks up at you. You can see that his face is beginning to tighten and become wrinkled with the powers that he uses. The powers are taking his life slowly, but he knows his fate: to be resurrected as a lich in Lord Soth's service. He is here to learn very difficult spells of necromancy from the one man who can teach him more.
NPC.longDescription: (Black Aura) A drow dressed in black robes contemplates the skeleton at his feet.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Mage
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden ProtectEvil DetectIllusion

NPC.name: nightgaunt black
NPC.description: The creature ... A nightgaunt, something conjured out of blackest horror and fear. It is oily and smooth, covered with thick, rubbery black hide and has two large horns on its head, stretching outwardss and curving back in. Its wings make no noise, its tail lashes needlessly and disturbingly. It does not speak, it does not even grin, for it has no face, just a blackness where a face should be. All it does is fly and crush and lash its tail. Such is its way.
NPC.longDescription: Something flaps its wings slowly in the air, invisible against the night.
NPC.flags: NPC StayArea Undead AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sneak Hide Flying DarkVision DetectIllusion

NPC.name: ghoul creature
NPC.description: The something appears to be some sort of ghoul, but you can't tell for certain. It is vaguely humanoid, vaguely canine ... It is something very foul and odious. The loathsome air around it stinks almost as bad as a dragon does, but with some sort of difference to it. The creature's hide is rubbery and unpleasant, covering a body that slumps forward, and has two arms ending in sharp claws, all topped with a dog-like head full of sharp, jagged incisors. It walks about on hoof-feet, something very odd ... There is something decidedly unnatural about the beast, whatever it may be.
NPC.longDescription: Something glares at you from the shadows .
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectHidden Infrared Sneak Hide DetectIllusion DetectInvis PassDoor DarkVision

Item.Name: armor blackened solamnic plate
Item.ShortDescription: a suit of blackened Solamnic plate
Item.LongDescription: An antique suit of black armor resembling the armor of the Solamnic Knights lays on the floor.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop AntiEvil NoRemove BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: It is embossed with what used to be the White Rose of Solamnia ... Now it is blackened all over, and the Rose is now Black.

Item.Name: throne
Item.ShortDescription: the black throne of Lord Soth
Item.LongDescription: A throne of flame-blasted black stone towers in the center of the hall.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is evil and darkened, and it feels like the focal point of the room ... Like the focal point for souls.

Item.Name: broadsword rusted jagged iron
Item.LongDescription: A rusty broadsword emitting undead intent lies on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: Although rusty, it is jagged and sharp, able to do heavy damage with one swing of its thick, heavy blade.

Item.Name: gloves gauntlets blackened solamnic
Item.ShortDescription: a pair of blackened Solamnic gauntlets
Item.LongDescription: Two black gauntlets bearing an uncanny resemblance to Solamnic armor lie here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop AntiNeutral NoRemove BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: They are blackened and evil, and glow with a slightly red unlight ... On each finger of the right glove are tiny red runes.

Item.Name: elven skirt torn tattered grey
Item.LongDescription: A pile of torn and tattered grey cloth has a slight odor of death and perfume.

ExtraDescription.Description: It looks like an old, worn elven skirt that was once snowy-white and decorated with beautiful designs, but time and something more profound than time has ruined it forever.

Item.Name: shield tower onyx
Item.ShortDescription: a tower shield of black onyx
Item.LongDescription: A large tower shield with a horrific bearing on it radiates black fire.

ExtraDescription.Keyword: black steel shield kite dying phoenix
ExtraDescription.Description: The phoenix depicted on the shield is being consumed by a black fire, and the impression is that this phoenix will never rise back to life again. The fire seems as if it is absorbing all light, as if it were real.

Item.Name: longsword pitchblack black
Item.ShortDescription: a longsword wrapped in black flame
Item.LongDescription: A longsword burning with black flame sears the ground and absorbs the light.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop AntiGood AntiNeutral BurnProof Frost Sharp Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: The blade is black and shaped like a forked tongue, and it is constantly dripping thick, red blood. The sword seems to take in all light and life around it.

Item.Name: wrappings head mummy decaying
Item.LongDescription: A pile of putrid, filthy rags is heaped on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: The rags are old and smell horrible, a combination of death and embalming fluids.

Item.Name: bed old musty
Item.LongDescription: An old, musty bed is in the corner of the room, the bedclothes eaten away.

ExtraDescription.Description: The bedclothes look like they've been eaten away by moths. The bed itself is giving off a damp, musty odor, probably from mold and fungus growing on it. You can at least try to use it ... If you're not too scared of something coming and eating YOU.

Item.Name: goblet silver fine blood
Item.LongDescription: A goblet of fine silver sits here.

ExtraDescription.Description: As you look inside the goblet, you see a distinctive red stain.

Item.Name: table dining long wooden
Item.LongDescription: A great dining table extends most of the length of the hall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The long, wooden table seems to not have aged at all. It is of the finest oak, covered with beautiful plates and candelabras.

Item.Name: scythe ethereal shimmering cold
Item.LongDescription: A shimmering scythe fades in and out of your sight.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic BurnProof Flaming Frost Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison

ExtraDescription.Description: The blade chills you as you touch the staff, and the aura around it feels like that of a wraith.

Item.Name: key tarnished silver
Item.LongDescription: A dull, tarnished silver key lies on the floor, encrusted with blood.

ExtraDescription.Description: It must have gleamed beautifully when it was new ... The key is sculpted with designs of intricate lace.

Item.Name: fourposter poster bed large
Item.LongDescription: A large four-poster bed is in the middle of the room.

ExtraDescription.Description: The bed must have been Soth's and his wife's. It was probably very beautiful at the time when it was in use, but now it is ruined and has not been used for a long, long time.

Item.Name: key courtyard nondescript
Item.LongDescription: A fairly normal key lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It's just a key, but on the head, it says "To the courtyard."

Item.Name: chandelier fallen crystal
Item.LongDescription: A fallen crystal chandelier has crushed a chair under its weight.

ExtraDescription.Description: The chandelier fell atop the chair to the right of the head of the table, the seat that would have belonged to Soth's wife. And as legend has it, before she died she cursed Soth to eternal corruption in an undead body with her last breath. Even now, the chandelier exudes evil and malice.

Item.Name: black chest oaken bolted steel
Item.LongDescription: A black chest bolted with steel sits beside the throne.

ExtraDescription.Description: The chest is made of oak, stained black and reinforced with steel.

Item.Name: simple steel key
Item.LongDescription: A simple key of steel is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is a simple key, with no real distinguishing features to it.

Item.Name: gold small amount coins
Item.LongDescription: A small amount of gold is in the chest.

Item.Name: red key bone barbed
Item.ShortDescription: a barbed red key of bone
Item.LongDescription: A crimson key of bone lies at your feet.

ExtraDescription.Description: The key is needle-sharp in places, smooth as bone in others. Its deep red glow gives you an idea of the evil power contained within.

Item.Name: wedding gown intangible elven
Item.LongDescription: A wedding gown that you can barely make out shimmers on the floor..
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Invis Magic AntiEvil VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: The gown looks smeared with blood, but still glowing with a faint bluish- gold aura of light and goodness. It is of obvious elven design, and is absolutely beautiful, even though it flickers in and out of your sight.

Item.Name: veil wedding immaterial elven
Item.LongDescription: An immaterial white wedding veil lies heaped on the floor.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Invis Magic AntiEvil VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: The veil shimmers in and out of your sight, even if you wear it. It is as if it were not wholly of this realm, nor wholly of the spiritual realm. The veil is beautiful and white, glowing with a magical radiance.

Item.Name: chair waiting old
Item.LongDescription: An old but comfortable-looking chair is up against the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The chair is old and big, but it still looks comfortable after untold years of not being used.

Item.Name: cape solamnic torn tattered black red cloak
Item.ShortDescription: a torn red and black Solamnic cape
Item.LongDescription: A torn, tattered and worn Solamnic cloak lies on the floor in a thick heap.

ExtraDescription.Keyword: cape torn tattered cloak solamnic red black
ExtraDescription.Description: The cape is ancient beyond belief, incredibly surviving unknown years and years of use and war. The cape is darkened with necromancy, and the once-white rose that graced the rear of the cloak is blackened.

Item.Name: nightstand table old
Item.LongDescription: An old nightstand is next to the bed.

ExtraDescription.Description: The nightstand is a beautifully carved piece of craftsmanship, possibly of either elven or dwarven creation. Intricate designs are carved all over the table, weaving in and out of each other with fluid grace.

Item.Name: shrine small stone
Item.LongDescription: A small stone shrine is set up against the eastern wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The shrine is small, made of fairly common grey stone, much like the stone that makes up the walls of the Keep. A small offering plate is on the shrine, used to hold gifts and sacrifices to Paladine and the gods of good, but of late, it has not been used at all, but it has not been defiled, either.

Item.Name: altar small wooden
Item.LongDescription: A small wooden altar is set up at the eastern wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The altar is a simple wooden altar, with some delicate stylizations of the gods of good on it. It is cushioned for kneeling in prayer, but the soft pillows used for it have since begun to rot away and crumble. Mysteriously, even though the Keep is inhabited by many undead, the altar has not been defiled or ruined in any way.

Item.Name: helmet full battle blackened solamnic
Item.ShortDescription: a blackened full Solamnic battle helmet
Item.LongDescription: A black full helm representing the armor of the Knights of Solamnia rests on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: The helmet is full around the face and head, protecting everything but the eyes. The air around the helmet is cold and strangely fearsome, like a great evil wore this helmet. The tassle on the helmet is vermillion, a deep red that seems like it was dyed with blood.

Item.Name: black heart skeleton burning
Item.ShortDescription: the black heart of a burning skeleton
Item.LongDescription: The impossibly beating black heart of a skeleton lies on the ground in a pool of blood.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop NoRemove VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: The beating is rhythmic ... Not so unnatural. Holding it, you get an evil feeling from the blood that drips down your hand constantly. And for as long as you've seen it, black blood has never ceased to pour from the horrific organ.

Item.Name: candelabra silver
Item.LongDescription: A silver candelabra is here, unused.

ExtraDescription.Description: There are enough candles in here to last for a long time, it seems.

Item.Name: hand axe iron green light
Item.ShortDescription: a light iron green-tinted hand axe
Item.LongDescription: A hand axe is tainted a peculiar green color.

ExtraDescription.Description: The surprising thing about this axe is its lightness for being made entirely of iron ... The other surprising thing is the odd green tint which the weapon has. Iron is usually reddish.

Item.Name: gnarled wooden staff steelcapped blue
Item.ShortDescription: a gnarled wooden staff capped with blue steel
Item.LongDescription: A gnarled wooden staff lies on the floor.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Magic AntiGood AntiEvil BurnProof Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison

ExtraDescription.Description: The staff is twisted and has a strange aura, neither holy nor unholy. At the tip of the steel cap is a worn symbol of the Healer.

Item.Name: mace obsidian emeralds inlaid
Item.ShortDescription: a massive obsidian mace inlaid with emeralds
Item.LongDescription: A black club sparkling with emeralds is glittering in the light.

ExtraDescription.Description: The club is almost too heavy to use. You'd have to be strong as a minotaur to even hold it with one hand. But it is absolutely beautiful, with all the emeralds set against the black obsidian.

Item.Name: platinum flail morningstar star diamond spiked
Item.ShortDescription: a platinum morningstar spiked with diamonds
Item.LongDescription: A silvery spiked flail lies unused on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: The head is beautiful, and the diamonds glitter in the light wonderfully. It is connected to the haft by a rather long chain, and the haft itself is carved from ebon wood. Into the central part of it is an elegant sign of the Platinum Dragon Claw.

Item.Name: window
Item.LongDescription: A window is carved out of the stone of the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: Looking out the window, out into the dark skies beyond the Keep, you get a feeling of peacefulness. You can see well into the distance, and you are quite high up in the Keep. A fall from this height would be fatal to you.

Item.Name: wisp ether ghostly
Item.LongDescription: A ghostly wisp floats passively in the air.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Invis Magic NoDrop NoRemove VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: It is somewhat immaterial, but you can still strangely touch and look at it.

Item.Name: bookshelf tall stone
Item.LongDescription: A tall stone bookshelf is carved into the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The bookshelf is elegantly carved out of the very wall.

Item.Name: solamnic code book old copy
Item.ShortDescription: a copy of the Solamnic Code
Item.LongDescription: An old book with a leather cover lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The code is a simple yet elegant book of parchment, small and beautiful. On the cover is simply inscribed "Est Sularus Oth Mithas."

Item.Name: footstool small oak
Item.LongDescription: An oak footstool is in front of the chair.

Item.Name: chair reading
Item.LongDescription: A reading chair is set beside the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: For as old as it must be, it still looks very comfortable.

Item.Name: desk oak
Item.LongDescription: A grand oak desk is against the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is beautiful and antique, and covered with a thick layer of dust. The craftsmanship is obviously dwarven, since you can barely tell where the individual pieces of the desk were fitted together.

Item.Name: large window
Item.LongDescription: A large window is opened in the north wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: Looking out the large picture window, you can see a hauntingly beautiful vista of the Vingaard mountains. Mist is all about them, and they look as if they were taken from a faerie tale.

Item.Name: window
Item.LongDescription: A wide window is carved out of the wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: The view here is breathtaking, like many of the creatures that now inhabit Dargaard Keep. You can see the misty mountaintops of Vingaard for miles and miles.

Item.Name: torso armor iron
Item.ShortDescription: the torso of a suit of armor
Item.LongDescription: The torso of an antique iron armor rocks on the floor.
Item.ExtraFlags: Magic NoDrop NoRemove NoPurge VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: The armor radiates magic and malevolence, daring any to wear it.

Item.Name: sword iron antique
Item.LongDescription: An old-looking iron sword lies on the ground.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop NoRemove VisDeath BurnProof Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: The sword doesn't look real, like it was taken from a sketch of a sword and given substance. It almost seems to be daring you to hold it in your hand.

Item.Name: fountain marble mossy mosscovered
Item.LongDescription: A large marble fountain, covered with black moss, has been built in the center of the clearing.

ExtraDescription.Description: The fountain may have been endlessly spraying water in its day, but now it has been corrupted and only endlessly spews forth a jet of thick red blood.

Item.Name: blood pool thick
Item.LongDescription: A pool of thick red blood seeps from beneath a stone wall to the west.

ExtraDescription.Description: The blood is slowly coming from the wall to the west, but the wall is just high enough so that you can't see over it.

Item.Name: log fallen grey tree
Item.LongDescription: A fallen tree lies on the cold soil of the courtyard.

ExtraDescription.Description: The tree seems to have been felled quite recently.

Item.Name: scimitar sword grey
Item.LongDescription: A sword rests here.

Item.Name: apple rotten
Item.LongDescription: An apple rots on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: Ugh ... Not even the worms will eat this one.

Item.Name: tapestry magic
Item.LongDescription: A tapestry that shows great acts of magic lies stretched out on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: A great battle of sorcerers is shown on this old tapestry, and great magical power flows from the cloth. It shimmers with energy.

Item.Name: tapestry war
Item.LongDescription: A tapestry showing a great scene of battle is laid out on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: The tapestry exhibits explicit acts of war and violence. Strong bloodlust exudes from the cloth.

Item.Name: bed bunked servants
Item.LongDescription: Two beds are bunked in the corner, one atop the other.

ExtraDescription.Description: The beds look narrow but comfortable, just enough for the servants that were employed here.

Item.Name: ring skull bone
Item.ShortDescription: a ring embellished with a skull
Item.LongDescription: A small ring of bone lies on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: The ring is made from smooth carved bone, and at the top, where a jewel would normally be, is a very tiny skull, something that would probably not be an easy thing to find in Krynn.

Item.Name: girdle steel black skull
Item.ShortDescription: a black steel girdle decorated with a skull
Item.LongDescription: A tight girdle made of blackened steel is on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: The girth looks tight ... You might have a hard time of getting the thing off. And although horrible, it is strangely beautiful. Something about it compels you to look at it, something about the image of pain projected by the skull.

Item.Name: rose ring black silver
Item.ShortDescription: a silver ring of the Order of the Rose
Item.LongDescription: A silver ring with a black rose on it glistens in the light.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is beautiful and ugly at the same time. Obviously of Solamnic make, although very old, it has been desecrated by evil and something about it makes you feel stronger and weaker at the same time.

Item.Name: ring ruby adamantite
Item.ShortDescription: a ruby ring streaked with adamantite
Item.LongDescription: A ring of solid red crystal laced with metal sticks out strangely.

ExtraDescription.Description: The ring is solid ruby, somehow marbled with adamantite. The effect is somewhat startling, so much that the pattern sticks in your mind. The colours blend together well, creating a feeling of strength.

Item.Name: scale vambraces stained
Item.ShortDescription: a pair of stained scale-mail vambraces
Item.LongDescription: Some scale-mail vambraces lie on the floor, glowing with a strange light.

ExtraDescription.Description: The armguards are stained, but still made of fine scale mail, closely linked to prevent a weapon from penetrating them and rendering the arms useless, which would be quite fatal in combat. But the stains ... They are quite strange. It is not blood which stains them, but the blemishes are red.

Item.Name: heavy scalemail greaves
Item.ShortDescription: a set of heavy scalemail greaves
Item.LongDescription: A pair of long greaves made of scalemail lie on the floor.

Item.Name: shackle black iron
Item.LongDescription: A thick band of forged iron lies on the floor, attached to a chain.

ExtraDescription.Description: The shackle looks very strong. It looks like you wouldn't be able to take it off very easily. But it does look like it will give you a decent amount of protection. And it looks like it could be fun later.

Item.Name: signet dargaard black
Item.LongDescription: A ring with royal symbols engraved on it lies on the floor, radiating evil.

ExtraDescription.Description: A ring of Dargaard Keep's ruler, engraved with symbols of might. Once being a knight of Solamnia this ring was a symbol of loyality and honor, now it only burns as a symbol of death and unlife, once carried by an undead knight.

Item.Name: head mummified dragon
Item.ShortDescription: a mummified head of black dragon
Item.LongDescription: A mummified head of a giant scaled beast lies on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: A large head of the black dragon has been severed and mummified as a deadly and powerful artifact. Black scales flare as they are being polished, and the head seems to be alive.

Item.Name: vial dragon blood
Item.ShortDescription: a crystal vial of dragon blood
Item.LongDescription: A crystal vial filled with bubbling liquid lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A large crystal vial has been filled with a strange, deep red liquid. It is bubbling with horrible smelling smoke.

Item.Name: rod cold ice
Item.ShortDescription: the black and blue crystal rod
Item.LongDescription: A rod forged from black and blue crystal lies on the ground.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop NoRemove BurnProof Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: A translucent crystal rod looks ghostly, absorbing the light around your hands. While you look at it, purple smoke appears inside it, shrouding the inside of the crystal. Creating a hypnotic feeling, it start shudders in your hands when all are effects gone, and rod starts to look like a useless piece of glass.

Item.Name: pendant bone
Item.ShortDescription: a pendant of two crossed bones
Item.LongDescription: A pendant made from trick of bones lies on the ground, radiating unholy powers.

ExtraDescription.Description: A pendant made as some kind of evil symbol. Ancient runes are engraved on crossed bones. Between the bones you can see a small demonic skull grinning at you with immense hatred.

Item.Name: whip bone
Item.LongDescription: A whip with the handle made from humanoid bone lies on the ground before your feet.

ExtraDescription.Description: A massive leather whip looks like a weapon of immense pain and torturing.

Item.Name: wings skeletal dracolich red
Item.ShortDescription: the red wings of a dracolich
Item.LongDescription: Two detached skeletal wings lie radiating hatred on the floor

ExtraDescription.Description: The wings are massive, and look heavy and unwieldy. They would probably restrict movement and agility drastically, but the aura of hate coming off them commands fear and weakness from foes.

Item.Name: head dracolich red freezing
Item.ShortDescription: the red skull of a mighty dracolich
Item.LongDescription: A skull lies on the ground, freezing the air around it.

ExtraDescription.Description: The skull is far too large to be used as a helmet of any kind, but something about the arrangement of the bones on the back make it look like it would be good as a shield, perhaps ... If it didn't bite you and not let go.

Item.Name: dracolich red claw helmet
Item.ShortDescription: the clenched claw of a red dracolich
Item.LongDescription: A large clenched claw lies on the floor.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop NoRemove VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: The claw is a bit big to be used as a weapon, but it is clenched enough so that it might fit on your head ... It could be a little tight, though.

Item.Name: spine red dracolich
Item.ShortDescription: the red spine of a great dracolich
Item.LongDescription: A coiled mass of hard red bone absorbs light around it.

ExtraDescription.Description: The spine is very long, long enough to coil around you twice, and thick enough to give a decent amount of protection. But to trust such an evil artifact of undeath ... Requires either great courage or great stupidity.

Item.Name: rib cage bone red dracolich
Item.ShortDescription: the rib cage of a red dracolich
Item.LongDescription: A red pair of greaves made from dragonbone lie on the floor.
Item.ExtraFlags: Evil Magic NoDrop NoRemove VisDeath BurnProof

ExtraDescription.Description: The rib cage is fairly small, considering it came from a dracolich. It's too small to fit onto your body, but you might be able to squeeze your legs into the bones.

Item.Name: skeleton
Item.LongDescription: A skeleton lies in a puddle of decayed flesh.

ExtraDescription.Description: The skeleton looks freshly decayed, as the puddle of molten flesh around it will testify.

Item.Name: dirk white-bladed serpentine
Item.LongDescription: A dirk with a white blade glistens in its own vileness.

ExtraDescription.Description: The dirk's wide white blade looks very sharp, even though it is scratched and chipped in numerous places. The hilt of the dagger is shaped like a serpent biting its own tail.

Item.Name: necklace tongue
Item.ShortDescription: a necklace of dried elven tongues
Item.LongDescription: A shuddering necklace made of chunks of flesh twitches on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: The tongues are strung together on a bit of iron wire. They are dried out, but strangely bloody. They writhe and twist, and occasionally they all scream at the same time, with a horrible noise to all.

Item.Name: tongue ghoul
Item.ShortDescription: the hideous black tongue of a ghoul-like being
Item.LongDescription: A tongue lies convulsing disquietingly on the floor, splashing saliva everywhere.

ExtraDescription.Description: The tongue writhes and writhes unceasingly, maddeningly, mindlessly. No rhyme or reason is behind it at all but black, foul magic from beyond the limits of imagination ... Magic from the edge of the world.

Item.Name: spear ice
Item.LongDescription: A long and dangerous looking spear lies here.

Item.Name: bandage mummy
Item.ShortDescription: some loose bandages of a mummy
Item.LongDescription: A pile of half-decayed cloth lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The bandages reek of rot and decay.

Item.Name: morningstar corroded
Item.LongDescription: A corroded morningstar lies here in a pool of blood.

ExtraDescription.Description: It's rusty, but still looks like it could be used safely. There are worse weapons one could use.

Item.Name: crystal talisman
Item.LongDescription: A talisman carved from blue and green crystal lies on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: What a beautiful necklace ... It radiates strange magics and mystical powers.

Item.Name: bracer glass polished
Item.ShortDescription: an bracer of polished black glass
Item.LongDescription: A small bracer made from dark glass lies on the ground, absorbing the light within itself.

Item.Name: tablet golden skull
Item.ShortDescription: a golden tablet engraved with a skull
Item.LongDescription: A tablet engraved with a skull lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The tablet is tarnished, and in the center is a skull. A few runes are on it, but not too many.

Item.Name: cross silver burned
Item.LongDescription: A cross made from silver lies here, covered by ash.

ExtraDescription.Description: The cross was probably beautiful in its day, but it has been desecrated.

Item.Name: banner of the dead
Item.LongDescription: A banner of the dead lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Something is not right about this banner.
